original: Lindblom, Adolf Fredrik, lasaretts-läkare, Växjö, f. 10/5/98 i Jönköping av tandläk. John L. o. Ottilia Sjöholm. G. 26 m. Marthe Eugenia Winckler. Barn: Ulf Fredrik f. 27, Nils Fredrik Staffan 32, Thomas Fredrik Ingemar 38. — Stud:ex. i Jönköping 16, med. kand. i Upps. 19, med. lic. 24 o. med. dr 26 i Sthlm. E. läk. v. tub :sjukh. i Arvika sju mån. 20-21, v. Eksjö sanat. 23, e. läk. i Anderslövs distr. två mån. 22-23, i Vaggeryds o. Norsjö distr. samt i Åmål kortare tider 24, aman. v. Karol. inst. patol. avd. 23, 25 o. 26, tf. läk. v. patol.-bakteriol. avd. i Umeå 25, und:läk. v. Sabbatsbergs sjukh. röntgenavd. 26-29, las :läk. v. Karlskrona las. röntgenavd. 29-35, v, Växjö las.-dito sed. 35. Fältläk :stip. i Fik 23, e. läk. v. olika reg. 23-24, bat:läk. i Fik res. 25-36. Utr. ■stud:resor 30-39. Skr.: avh. o. upps. i patol. o. röntgenologi. Hobby: trädgårdsskötsel.
translated: Lindblom, Adolf Fredrik, hospital doctor, Växjö, born 10/5/98 in Jönköping to dentist John L. and Ottilia Sjöholm. Married on 26th with Marthe Eugenia Winckler. Children: Ulf Fredrik born in 1927, Nils Fredrik Staffan in 1932, Thomas Fredrik Ingemar in 1938. — Graduated from Jönköping high school in 1916, medical candidate in Uppsala in 1919, medical licentiate in 1924 and medical doctor in Stockholm in 1926. Worked as assistant doctor at tuberculosis hospital in Arvika for seven months from 1920-21, at Eksjö sanatorium in 1923, as attending doctor in Anderslöv district for two months in 1922-23, in Vaggeryd and Norsjö districts, and also in Åmål for shorter periods in 1924. Assistant at Karolinska Institute pathology department in 1923, 1925 and 1926, temporary doctor at the pathology-bacteriology department in Umeå in 1925, and assistant doctor at Sabbatsberg hospital radiology department from 1926-1929. Hospital doctor at Karlskrona hospital radiology department from 1929-1935, and at Växjö hospital since 1935. Military doctor scholarship in 1923, served as a doctor in various regiments from 1923-1924, and as battalion doctor in Fik from 1925-1936. Traveled abroad for study trips from 1930-1939. Published papers and research in pathology and radiology. Hobby: gardening.
